name: 蔡明誠
objective:
A discrete mathematics course has many purposes. Students should learn a particular set of mathematical facts and how to apply them. Moreover, such a course should teach students how to think logically and mathematically. This course will include: 
1. The fundamentals of discrete mathematics. 
2. Combinatory. 
3. The theory and applications of finite graphs and applied algebra. 
4. Discrete mathematics in computer science.
schedule:
1. Logic and Proofs
2. Sets, Functions, Sequences, Sums, and Matrices
3. Algorithms
4. Elementary Number Theory and Cryptography
5. Induction and Recursion
6. Counting
7. Discrete Probability
8. Advanced Counting Techniques
9. Relations
10. Graphs
11. Trees
12. Boolean Algebra
13. Finite state machines and formal languages
14. Concrete mathematics
scorePolicy:
In-class participation: 15%
Tests (not including Midterm and final exams): 30% (twice)
Midterm exam: 25%
Final exam: 30%
materials:
1. Kenneth H. Rosen, Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications, 7th Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2012.
2. Richard A. Brualdi, Introductory Combinatorics, 5th Edition
